awd_abstract_narration: This award is made as part of the FY 2017 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to William Chan is "Descriptive Set Theory and Definable Sets." The host institution for the fellowship is the University of North Texas, and the sponsoring scientist is Stephen Jackson.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The axiom of determinacy is the assertion that in any two-player game, where each player selects one integer per turn to steer an infinite sequence of integers in or out of a predetermined payoff set, has a winning strategy for one of the two players. It is incompatible with another common postulate called the axiom of choice; however, determinacy axioms tend to endow infinite sets with structures often found in definable mathematics such as descriptive set theory and recursion theory. 

 Mathematical size or cardinality between sets are compared through injective and bijective correspondence. This project seek to understand the structure of the cardinalities of sets under determinacy axioms. 

Classically, the axiom of determinacy completely characterizes the cardinalities below the power set of the natural numbers in a manner satisfying a version of the continuum hypothesis. This project distinguished the cardinality of some notable subsets of the first and second uncountable cardinal. Important tools used here are the infinite partition relations on these cardinals which are similar to infinite Ramsey properties on the natural numbers. Partition properties under determinacy are closely connected to definability and they provide very useful ultrafilters on partition spaces. Injections from partition spaces into ordinals are analyzed through almost everywhere continuity properties with respect to these ultrafilters to obtain results resembling the classical fact of determinacy that every function from the real number to the real numbers is continuous almost everywhere (on a comeager set).

Under some determinacy assumptions or in natural models of determinacy, sets of reals have highly absolute definitions. These definitions can be used to absorb certain functions into inner models of the axiom of choice while preserving certain truths between these inner models and the determinacy universe. The project used such techniques to analyze injections between subsets of the power set of the first uncountable cardinals and make cardinality distinction between sets outside the influence of partition properties. These highly absolute definitions have also been useful in establishing structure for linear orderings and trees. Such results have been used to exclude the existence of pathological linear orderings in the determinacy setting. 

During this project, the PI participated in the training of young researchers in determinacy and descriptive set theory. The PI held tutorial lectures on determinacy at a set theory summer school for undergraduate and graduate students. The PI also taught a topic course on determinacy which resulted in an expository article which serves as a gentle introduction to determinacy in very simple settings. 

 


Last Modified: 10/01/2021
Modified by: William Chan
